gospel.text:
[[Lc 11,1]]Jesus was praying in a certain place, and when he had finished, one of his disciples said to him, "Lord, teach us to pray just as John taught his disciples."
[[Lc 11,2]]He said to them, "When you pray, say: Father, hallowed be your name, your kingdom come.
[[Lc 11,3]]Give us each day our daily bread
[[Lc 11,4]]and forgive us our sins for we ourselves forgive everyone in debt to us, and do not subject us to the final test."
gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Luke

psalm.text:
[[Ps 86,3]]Have mercy on me, O Lord,
for to you I call all the day.
[[Ps 86,4]]Gladden the soul of your servant, 
for to you, O Lord, I lift up my soul.

[[Ps 86,5]]For you, O Lord, are good and forgiving, 
abounding in kindness to all who call upon you.
[[Ps 86,6]]Hearken, O LORD, to my prayer 
and attend to the sound of my pleading.

[[Ps 86,9]]All the nations you have made shall come
and worship you, O Lord,
and glorify your name.
[[Ps 86,10]]For you are great, and you do wondrous deeds;
you alone are God.
psalm.title: Psalms

first_reading.text:
[[Jon 4,1]]Jonah was greatly displeased and became angry that God did not carry out the evil he threatened against Nineveh.
[[Jon 4,2]]"I beseech you, LORD," he prayed, "is not this what I said while I was still in my own country? This is why I fled at first to Tarshish. I knew that you are a gracious and merciful God, slow to anger, rich in clemency, loathe to punish.
[[Jon 4,3]]And now, LORD, please take my life from me; for it is better for me to die than to live."
[[Jon 4,4]]But the LORD asked, "Have you reason to be angry?"
[[Jon 4,5]]Jonah then left the city for a place to the east of it, where he built himself a hut and waited under it in the shade, to see what would happen to the city.
[[Jon 4,6]]And when the LORD God provided a gourd plant, that grew up over Jonah's head, giving shade that relieved him of any discomfort, Jonah was very happy over the plant.
[[Jon 4,7]]But the next morning at dawn God sent a worm which attacked the plant, so that it withered.
[[Jon 4,8]]And when the sun arose, God sent a burning east wind; and the sun beat upon Jonah's head till he became faint. Then he asked for death, saying, "I would be better off dead than alive."
[[Jon 4,9]]But God said to Jonah, "Have you reason to be angry over the plant?" "I have reason to be angry," Jonah answered, "angry enough to die."
[[Jon 4,10]]Then the LORD said, "You are concerned over the plant which cost you no labor and which you did not raise; it came up in one night and in one night it perished.
[[Jon 4,11]]And should I not be concerned over Nineveh, the great city, in which there are more than a hundred and twenty thousand persons who cannot distinguish their right hand from their left, not to mention the many cattle?"
first_reading.title: Book of Jonah
